title: South African Markets - Factors to watch on Sept 17
text:
© Reuters. South African Markets - Factors to watch on Sept 17

The following company announcements, scheduled economic indicators, debt and currency market moves and political events may affect South African markets on Tuesday.

ECONOMIC EVENTS

South Africa's Treasury auctions long-term bond notes

SOUTH AFRICAN MARKETS

South Africa's rand weakened on Monday, with global risk appetite dented by a weekend attack on Saudi Arabian refining facilities that hit global oil supplies and saw prices spike.

On the bourse, stocks strengthened, with the Johannesburg All-share index up 1.3% to 57,854 points, while the benchmark Top-40 index rose 1.3% to 51,802 points. .J ZAR/

GLOBAL MARKETS

Oil shed some of its massive gains on Tuesday as the United States flagged the possible release of crude reserves, but the threat of military action over the attacks on Saudi oil facilities kept prices elevated and stocks under pressure. MKTS/GLOB

WALL STREET

Energy stocks spiked while most of Wall Street fell on Monday after weekend attacks on Saudi Arabia's oil facilities added to investors' concerns about geopolitical risk and a stumbling global economy. .N

GOLD

Gold traded steady on Tuesday as most traders stayed on the sidelines ahead of a widely expected rate cut by the U.S. Federal Reserve later this week. GOL/
